definition: to gossip and meddle/to shoot one's mouth off/talkative
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
mouth/beak/nozzle/spout (of teapot etc)/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
tongue

sentences.english: So we're not going to give in-depth commentary on the IE team's decision.
sentences.chinese: 所以我們不會對IE團隊的決定多嘴多舌。
還不夠麼？你這個多嘴多舌的傢伙。

sentences.english: Do not tell her anything because she's a blabber- mouth.
sentences.chinese: 她是個多嘴多舌的人，別告訴她任何事。

sentences.english: He is a loudmouth who cannot be trusted with secrets.
sentences.chinese: 他是個多嘴多舌的人，不能相信他能爲別人保守祕密。
她的多嘴多舌常常惹他發火。
你親切而有同情心，但是你多嘴多舌的。
他真是個多嘴多舌的人。

sentences.english: He never stopped kibitzing when we played cards.
sentences.chinese: 在我們玩牌時他一直亂出主意，多嘴多舌。

sentences.english: The real in us is silent; the acquired is talkative.
sentences.chinese: 我們的真我是沉默的，後天之我卻多嘴多舌。

sentences.english: They think a girl who gossips is a bore .
sentences.chinese: 他們認爲多嘴多舌的女孩特煩人。

sentences.english: See if yu can keep your brother—who is a blabbermouth—to keep this still.
sentences.chinese: 看你是否能讓你那個多嘴多舌的兄弟保守住這個祕密。

definition: talkative/to speak out of turn/to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/rumors fly
to gossip/to argue unnecessarily
to gossip/to argue unnecessarily
to gossip/to argue unnecessarily

to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief
lit. to discuss sb's merits and demerits (idiom); to gossip
meddling in other people's business
to stir up trouble
not knowing when to come or leave (idiom); with no sense of propriety
to fail to see the larger issue (idiom)/to fail to grasp the big picture
to cause sth unfortunate to happen (to oneself or sb else)/to do sth inauspicious/to have a stroke of bad luck
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
